projects.body:
My experiences in the worlds of design, \
public programming, exhibitions, and education equip me with a unique collection \
of skills and a valuable lens in which to view your next project.

I offer a variety of services, including concept development, creative strategy, design, and project supervision.

projects.title: ### BALL REDBOOK
projects.body: The 19th edition of the *Ball RedBook* consists of two volumes and nearly 1,000 pages of information about annuals, perennials, greenhouses, and growing technology. The design of this "bible" of the greenhouse industry was completed while working closely with the project's co-designer.

projects.title: ### MUSE HANDBOOK
projects.body: Students new to the Master of Arts in Museum and Exhibition Studies program at the University of Illinois Chicago use this 44-page book as a guide to their studies.

projects.title: ### Community Cultural Fund Report
projects.body: A tri-fold brochure was designed to encourage support for the American Library Association’s Cultural Communities Fund, an endowment that provides funding for cultural and civic programming in libraries of all types.

projects.title: ### Berwyn Mayoral Campaign Logos
projects.body: These campaign logos were designed to provide a visual cue of the candidate’s key messages, build name recognition, and connect the candidate with Berwyn residents. The bold, modern design radiates energy, strength, and optimism and seeks to appeal to youth engagement with the community.
projects.alt: Boy riding in convertible holding campaign sign with campaign logo.

projects.title: ### HandPicked Vegetables Brochure
projects.body:
Production work for this 16-page brochure featuring PanAmerican Seed’s HandPicked collection was completed while working closely with the project’s Art Director.

© Ball Horticultural Company
projects.alt: Cover for the Handpicked Vegetables brochure.

projects.title: ### *Latino Americans* Report
projects.body: This 64-page *Latino Americans: 500 Years of History* report was designed to highlight the National Endowment for the Humanities and American Library Association Public Programs Office’s nationwide public programming initiative that supported the exploration of the rich and varied history and experiences of Latinos, who have helped shape the United States over the last five centuries.
projects.alt: Cover for the Latino Americans report.

projects.title: ### *Muslim Journeys* Report
projects.body: This 46-page *Muslim Journeys* report was designed to highlight the National Endowment for the Humanities and American Library Association Public Programs Office’s multi-faceted effort to bring humanities programming about Islamic history and culture to libraries and state humanities councils across the country.
projects.alt: Cover for the Muslim Journeys Report.

projects.title: ### Burpee Recipe Cards
projects.body:
These recipe cards were designed to feature Burpee vegetables and to highlight recipe ideas showcasing the bounty of the garden.

© Ball Horticultural Company
projects.alt: Burpee recipe card for cupcake squash.

### LEAVE NO CHILD INSIDE BOOKLET
projects.body: This booklet was designed to help educate parents about the Leave No Child Inside Initiative, which promotes the benefits to children of outdoor play in nature.

projects.title: ### PEACEMAKER BANNERS
projects.body: Eighteen banners featuring African American leaders were designed for an exhibition at the Jane Addams Hull-House Museum. The eight-foot-tall banners were displayed from the ceiling of the Hull-House dining room.

projects.title: ### HYDE PARK ART CENTER GUIDE
projects.body: This double-gatefold map and art education activity was designed in conjunction with *Takeover*, the opening exhibition at the new Hyde Park Art Center.

projects.title: ### *MAP* OBJECT LABELS
projects.body: More than fifty wall and case labels were designed for the Newberry Library exhibit *Mapping Manifest Destiny: Chicago and the American West*, part of Chicago’s Festival of Maps.
